group_1.textRight: Are you doing any better?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. My magic's all topped up, and I'm feeling@juuust fine.
Honestly, when I was holding the Witch back@by myself...
I thought I might've just *died* out there!

group_1.textRight: That's just how severe the situation was, I'd say.

group_1.textLeft: How are all the other girls doing?

group_1.textRight: They've gone home for the day.
They still have a lot of questions, of course, but they @can wait for another time.

group_1.textLeft: I see.

group_1.textRight: Feel free to tell us what you know about@Endless Mirrors some time.

group_1.textLeft: There's something that I think.

group_1.textRight: Mitama?

group_1.textLeft: I think that Endless Mirrors is trying to make friends @for itself in an imaginary house...
So that it can play with a pretend family.

group_1.textRight: ...Would you happen to have any tea?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. I'll put the kettle on...

group_1.textRight: I'll hear your theory once we've sat down.
So with all this about 'playing house', and about@a specific person dying...
What exactly do you know?

group_1.textLeft: It's all just speculation...
But I believe that Endless Mirrors used to be a @Magical Girl from Daito.

group_1.textRight: From Daito...?

group_1.textLeft: Yes.
A girl named Mikoto Sena... Though I never met her @in person.

group_1.textRight: But I imagine you still have a reason to believe@it was her.

group_1.textLeft: Yes...

group_1.narration: It started when I became a Coordinator, @and learned about Witch transformation.
While I was looking into Magical Girls@who'd gone missing in Kamihama, @I heard the name "Mikoto Sena" from Kanagi,@and began investigating her.
My search led me to Swindlers' Town.
There was a single woman standing@in front of Mikoto Sena's gravestone,@where she'd been buried in Daito's municipal graveyard.@I knew right away that the woman was her mother.
I told her mother that@I'd been a close friend of her daughter,@and she invited me to her house. @She had a small Buddhist altar there.
There was a photo of Mikoto Sena in front of it, @and a single campus notebook...
She'd written a few things about@her time as a Magical Girl inside it, @but the majority of what she wrote@was about her ideals and her regrets.

About how her household had fallen apart@because of her wish. @About how she wanted to have been raised by@a more proper mother and father. @About how she couldn't believe that@her mother had run away...
It seemed that she had been@drawing out an ideal family in her head, @and convincing herself that her real-world family@were imposters.
And it seemed as if she didn't trust anybody, @apart from "one single Magical Girl."

group_1.textLeft: Of course, she didn't literally write any of it down in@those words.
But as I read through her notebook and thought @about it, that was essentially what it said.

group_1.textRight: I see.
So Endless Mirrors is a space where she can build @her ideal family...?

group_1.textLeft: It's just a feeling I have, but yes, I think so.
And the way it closes off its heart, not making @contact with anyone...
It's just like the way she was in life.
I think this also explains the copies that it creates...
In addition to that, the unique magic she originally @had was "suggestion."

group_1.textRight: Suggestion?

group_1.textLeft: That'd be the perfect ability to use...
...if you were a Witch that wanted to prevent people@from seeing you as dangerous, right?

group_1.textRight: That really seems like quite a stretch.
...Or perhaps the fact that I just said that was @*itself* a result of suggestion?

group_1.textLeft: You just start going in circles from there, @so I can't think about it too deeply.
But if she came out of her usual hiding spot, @and were to attack a human...
I felt like that'd be the last nail in the coffin.

group_1.textRight: You'd know whether it was Mikoto Sena based on @who the Witch cursed?

group_1.textLeft: Yes...
She staked her life on her wish in order to support @her mother, who was suffering in their household...
But as her mother became free and uninhibited, @she abandoned them and disappeared.
If there was one person that the Witch would resent, @despite being so reclusive...
I thought it could only be her.

group_1.textRight: So today...
"The fact that her mother lives in Swindlers' Town@is what made your hypothesis into reality."

group_1.textLeft: Yes.

group_1.textRight: I don't think I would conclude that just yet.
The whole thing strikes me as a lot of circumstantial@evidence being forced together.
...But it's better than not hypothesizing at all, @I suppose.

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry, Yachiyo-san.@I just felt the need to let it all out...

group_1.textRight: It's okay. We all feel that way at times.
I think it's a hypothesis well worth considering, too.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you.
...Now then! @Let's put this whole topic to rest, shall we?
I think I'm going to refrain from exploring Mirrors @for a little while.
Connecting to a whole other Labyrinth was just @such a bizarre thing, after all!
It would be best to resume activity after getting@the whole situation sorted out for ourselves.

group_1.textRight: I agree.

group_1.textLeft: I'll contact everyone and let them know some time@soon~.
Oh, and I'd better put up some posters in the shop @too!

group_1.narration: I really hope that it's just some silly fantasy of mine. @I want to be wrong about it.
If that date in the notebook@really is the date when she became a Witch, @I'd be horrified...
Because the day that she became a Witch...
[textRed: Was the same day that I made my wish.]
